column4: hello:  subversion will not install from the ubuntu servers.  i was wondering if this was a known problem, or more isolated
Package subversion is not available, but is referred to by another package.
Alright, please pastebin the output of `sudo apt-get update`
pastebin wont accept it. labels it spam
Meh.  paste.ubuntu.com will work, that factoid got long
alright, this all looks good.  Please pastebin the output of apt-cache policy subversion
theres a hardy line in there for some reason? "Hardy/main"
Yeah, there is.  You should probably clean up your sources.list, but that line won't cause a problem
but again, won't cause problems now.  What about that apt-cache policy subversion?
alright, that says that it should be available.  Does sudo apt-get install subversion still give you an erro?
Odd indeed.  Unfortunately I have to run now.  Someone else should be able to help.  I've never seen that before.  Try cleaning up your sources.list (including .d) and see if that helps?
